required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genomic BRCA and Extensive ovArian Cancer Testing
clinical_study.official_title: Cohort Study to Evaluate the Clinical Features of Patients With Epithelial Ovarian Cancer Depending on Tumoral Mutation of BRCA or Beyond BRCA Genomic Molecular Abnormalities

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective observational French multicenter cohort in patients with ovarian and/or primitive peritoneal and/or fallopian tubes carcinoma, histologically confirmed, with an advanced stage at diagnosis (stage III to IV FIGO 2014). The objective is to constitute a clinico-biological database that allows to correlate clinical and progressive features of ovarian cancer patients based on tumor genomics and molecular detected abnormalities.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between Progression Free Survival (PFS) and the detected tumor genetic abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline until the date of progression or death, which ever occurs earlier, assessed up to 10 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between age and the detected tumor genetic abnormalities
Correlation between histology status and the detected tumor genetic abnormalities
Correlation between FIGO stage and the detected tumor genetic abnormalities
Correlation between surgery resection status and the detected tumor genetic abnormalities
Correlation between treatment response and the detected tumor genetic abnormalities
Correlation between Overall survival (OS) and the detected tumor genetic abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to death, assessed up to 10 years

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with both germinal and tumoral BRCA tests
Percentage of patients with a first germinal BRCA test, a first tumoral BRCA test, or simultaneous germinal and tumoral tests
Percentage of patients with and exploitable tumoral block for exploratory transversal researches

biospec_descr.textblock: Tumor sample fixed in formalin and included in paraffin (FFPE)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with ovarian and/or primitive peritoneal and/or fallopian tubes carcinoma, histologically confirmed, with an advanced stage at diagnosis (stage III to IV FIGO 2014)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient older than 18 years.
- Patient with ovarian and/or primitive peritoneal and/or fallopian tubes carcinoma, histologically confirmed, with an advanced stage at diagnosis (stage III to IV FIGO 2014)
- Patient in first line therapy
- Available tumor sample fixed in formalin and included in paraffin (FFPE):
- in pre-chemotherapy, insofar as possible
- having a sufficient tumor surface, with a final cellularity of at least 20%
- Identification of a molecular genetics' cancer platform and an onco-geneticists team working with the investigator team
- Patient consenting her data to be collected and submitted through an automated processing
- Patient beneficiary from the French social security
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with a mucinous ovarian carcinoma
- Patient pregnant or breastfeeding
- Patient under legal protection (guardianship or court order) or unable to consent
